thread.title_full: iBall to pay Rs 10,000 for defective gadget - The Times of India

author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
title: iBall to pay Rs 10,000 for defective gadget
text:
PUNE: A Mumbai-based manufacturer of electronic gadgets and its distributor have been directed by the Pune District Consumer Disputes Redressal Forum to refund Rs 6,000, along with Rs 3,000 as compensation and Rs 1,000 for costs, to a Kasba Peth resident for selling him a defective tab.

The forum, headed by VP Utpat, ruled on September 4 that failure to refund money along with the penalties, within six weeks from the date of order, will attract interest at the rate of 9% per annum from the date of filing of the complaint till realization.

Complainant Vinod Nandre had purchased an IBALL slide tab for Rs 6,000 from the company's authorized distributor in Navi Peth on January 4, 2014. Nandre wanted to gift the tab to his sister and had kept it in a packed condition for two months before he opened the package. However, he found that the touch screen of the equipment was not functioning.

Since March 2014, Nandre referred the defective tab to the company's authorized distributor for repairs but did not get any satisfactory response. He eventually moved the district consumer forum on September 29, 2014 alleging deficiency on part of the company in selling him a used and defective tab. The company contested his claim during the hearing and argued that the tab was repaired to Nandre's satisfaction but he refused to take it back.

The forum relied on documentary evidence like receipt of purchase of tab, correspondence between Nandre and the firm and oral submissions and observed that the company had failed to produce any evidence to support its claim that the tab had been repaired.

It held that the company has caused deficiency in service by selling a defective equipment to the complainant and hence was liable to refund the purchase amount with penalties for causing mental and physical agony.
